intro: Maesa kurzii, commonly known as the Kloss maesa, is a flowering plant native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
